posts.title: Exciting Trail Updates In Development for NWA Mountain Bikers
posts.content:
Trailblazers recently shared some exciting infrastructure updates around the region, including the start of a unique treehouse project in the center of the Bluebird Loop trail in Bella Vista.

Heating Up: A beginner skill-building trail called Wildfire is now complete, serving as a progression to the more advanced Uwambami, where riders can practice berms, features, and jumps in an easily repeatable experience. The crew now turns to the ‚ÄúFirnas‚Äù project ‚Äî the world's first adaptive skill-building jump trail, set to open this fall.

The Climb: The Trailblazers team is also partnering with the Arkansas Climbers Coalition to develop a climbing center at an undisclosed location to help grow the climbing sport in our region by offering world-class beginner to expert trails.

Get the latest updates from Trailblazers HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Gears Up for Arkansas Razorback Football
posts.content:
HogTown is back for the 2023 Razorback football season, bringing the ultimate pre-game party to Maple St. with live music, food trucks, a beer garden, giveaways, and more.

The Whole Shebang: Meet Tusk VI, the beloved live mascot, enjoy pep rallies with the Razorback Spirit Squads and Marching Band, and take part in the Hog Walk with the football team and Head Coach Sam Pittman.

On Stage: A great lineup of musicians has been announced for HogTown, kicking off with indie soul and rock n' roll group The Cole Birmingham Band on Sep 9 before the Razorbacks take on Kent State.

Head over to our Instagram and enter for a chance to win a pair of season tickets. Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Dr. Compton Native Tree & Plant Sale Means Fall Is Nearly Here
posts.content:
Get your gardens ready for winter and shop over 40 varieties of Arkansas native trees, shrubs, and perennials during the Dr. Compton Native Tree & Plant Sale, lasting Sep 28-30.

Home Grown: The Native Tree & Plant Sale is a great opportunity for the community to purchase Ozark native plants, many of which are grown in-house at Compton Gardens using seeds sourced from the gardens.

It‚Äôs Fall, Y‚Äôall: Hosted at the Compton Gardens Maintenance Office at 407 NE B St in Bentonville, the sale will be open to the public with no reservation required. Come find the perfect plants to take root in your yard and garden this fall.

Find a full list of plant varieties on sale HERE.

posts.title: Shop 100+ Local Vendors During the Black Owned NWA Business Expo
posts.content:
Celebrate National Black Business Month at the Black Owned NWA Business Expo at the Fayetteville Town Center & Fayetteville Town Square this Saturday, Aug 26, from 5-9p.

Build Community: The Expo provides a physical and digital platform for Black businesses, events, and resources with the goal of helping members of the Black Community thrive in Northwest Arkansas.

Shop Local: Explore over 100 vendors from the region, featuring items ranging from vintage clothing and candles to baked goods, hot tea, and samosas. The event is free and open to the public.

Reserve your free tickets to the Black Owned NWA Business Expo HERE.
